algorithm_technique: Uses generating functions and combinatorics to count permutations with repetitions.
Backtracking to explore all possible sequences by picking and removing tiles.
problem_summary_simple: Count all unique non-empty letter sequences from given tiles.
problem_summary_technical: Counts permutations of subsets of tiles, handling duplicate letters.
key_insights: The problem involves permutations with repetitions, which can be solved using combinatorics.
The generating function approach models the selection of letters and their counts.
Backtracking is a natural fit for exploring all possible sequences.
Using a frequency map (Counter) efficiently tracks available tiles.
